programme.desc: A pregnant police chief (Frances McDormand) probes the murderous events that evolved from a desperate car salesmans (William H. Macy) kidnapping scheme.

programme.title: Foxy Brown (1974)
programme.desc: A nurse (Pam Grier) takes revenge on a drug ring for the slaying of her undercover-officer boyfriend.

programme.title: Coffy (1973)
programme.desc: A nurse (Pam Grier) seeks revenge on those she holds responsible for her 11-year-old sisters drug addiction.

programme.title: Man of the West (1958)
programme.desc: A reformed Texas outlaw (Gary Cooper), a con man and a singer (Julie London) meet the outlaws old gang.

programme.title: Easy Money (1983)
programme.desc: Photographer Monty (Rodney Dangerfield) will be rich from his late mother-in-laws (Geraldine Fitzgerald) estate if he can curb his vices for a year.

programme.title: Whats the Worst That Could Happen? (2001)
programme.sub-title: Whats the Worst That Could Happen? (2001)
programme.desc: When a professional thief robs a beachfront mansion, he catches the owner in a compromising situation.

programme.title: Get Shorty (1995)
programme.desc: A film-loving loan shark (John Travolta) teams with a B-movie producer (Gene Hackman) to become a Hollywood mogul.

programme.title: Be Cool (2005)
programme.desc: Chili Palmer (John Travolta) runs afoul of music-industry players when he teams up with a friends widow (Uma Thurman) to produce a singers debut album.

programme.title: Death at a Funeral (2007)
programme.desc: Secret revelations and chaos reign when members of a dysfunctional British family gather to lay their patriarch to rest.

programme.title: Married to the Mob (1988)
programme.desc: An FBI agent (Matthew Modine) gets close to a gangsters widow (Michelle Pfeiffer) in order to nab a crime boss (Dean Stockwell).

programme.title: Desperately Seeking Susan (1985)
programme.desc: A bored housewife (Rosanna Arquette) with amnesia thinks she is "Susan," a wild woman (Madonna) on the run.

programme.title: The First Wives Club (1996)
programme.desc: Three 50-ish college friends (Goldie Hawn, Bette Midler, Diane Keaton) plot revenge after their husbands dump them for younger women.

programme.title: Pretty in Pink (1986)
programme.desc: A rich teen (Andrew McCarthy) asks an unpopular student (Molly Ringwald) to the senior prom, creating problems among their separate circles of friends.

programme.title: Terms of Endearment (1983)
programme.desc: A strong-willed woman (Shirley MacLaine) and her equally independent daughter (Debra Winger) keep the lines of communication open as each deals with the curveballs life throws at them.

programme.title: The Importance of Being Earnest (2002)
programme.desc: Complications arise after two bachelors (Rupert Everett, Colin Firth) make use of the same pseudonym in 19th-century England.

programme.title: The Fortune Cookie (1966)
programme.desc: A TV cameraman hurt while covering a football game is told by his brother-in-law how to get a big insurance settlement.

programme.title: Sidewalks of New York (2001)
programme.desc: A television producer (Edward Burns), a teacher (Rosario Dawson), a musician, a waitress, a dentist and a real estate agent deal with rocky romances.

programme.title: The Duchess (2008)
programme.desc: Determined to be an important figure in affairs of state, the Duchess of Devonshire (Keira Knightley) rises to the forefront of the Whig Party in the late 1700s and ushers in reforms.

programme.title: Congo (1995)
programme.desc: Killer gorillas menace an ex-CIA agent (Laura Linney), a primatologist (Dylan Walsh) and others on a mission in Africa.

programme.title: Hercules (2014)
programme.desc: Now a traveling mercenary, Hercules must once again become a hero to help the benevolent king of Thrace protect his people from a powerful warlord.

programme.title: Donnie Brasco (1997)
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent (Johnny Depp) uses the patronage of an unwitting mobster (Al Pacino) to infiltrate the New York Mafia.

programme.title: A Working Man (2025)
programme.desc: Levon Cade left behind a military career in the black ops to live a simple life. However, when human traffickers kidnap his bosss daughter, his search to bring her home uncovers a world of corruption far greater than he ever could have imagined.

programme.title: The Hillside Strangler
programme.sub-title: City of Dreams, City of Nightmares
programme.desc: Ten women are slain, their bodies dumped across the iconic hillsides of Los Angeles; activists demand justice as the media turns murder into spectacle; detectives Frank Salerno and Pete Finnigan race to stop the killer before he strikes again.

programme.title: Shutter Island (2010)
programme.desc: A 1950s lawman (Leonardo DiCaprio) pursues a murderess who appears to have vanished from a locked room within a fortresslike psychiatric hospital.

programme.title: The Package (1989)
programme.desc: An Army sergeant (Gene Hackman) and his officer ex-wife (Joanna Cassidy) are caught in a Cold War plot over a military prisoner (Tommy Lee Jones).

programme.title: The High and the Mighty (1954)
programme.desc: On a flight from Hawaii to California, the engine dies on the plane Dan is flying. As he prepares for a crash landing, the passengers reassess their lives.

programme.title: All Dogs Go to Heaven (1989)
programme.desc: A junkyard dog returns to Earth from heaven thanks to the powers of a magical, rewindable watch, though his objective changes as he watches events unfold in his former stomping grounds.

programme.title: Comes a Horseman (1978)
programme.desc: A rancher (James Caan) back from World War II helps a woman (Jane Fonda) fight a cattle baron (Jason Robards) who wants their Colorado land.

programme.title: Tommys Honour (2016)
programme.desc: Tom and Tommy Morris, father and son pioneers of professional golf, relied on skill, business acumen and working-class street smarts to make Tommy one of the worlds first sports superstars and found the modern game of golf.

programme.title: Wild Bill (1995)
programme.desc: The legendary gunfighter (Jeff Bridges) resumes romance with Calamity Jane (Ellen Barkin), faces an upstart and copes with his past in late-1800s Dakota Territory.

programme.title: Runaway Train (1985)
programme.desc: Escaped convicts (Jon Voight, Eric Roberts) and a stowaway girl (Rebecca De Mornay) ride an unmanned diesel speeding out of control through Alaska.

programme.title: The Mod Squad (1999)
programme.desc: A police captain saves three young adults (Claire Danes, Giovanni Ribisi, Omar Epps) from jail, recruiting them to work under cover in Los Angeles.

programme.title: The Saint (1997)
programme.desc: Master-of-disguises Simon Templar (Val Kilmer) falls for a U.S. scientist (Elisabeth Shue) whose cold-fusion formula he must steal.

programme.title: Days of Thunder (1990)
programme.desc: An upstart stock-car driver goes to the edge for his manager, his brain-surgeon girlfriend and himself.

programme.title: Gladiator II (2024)
programme.desc: Lucius must enter the Colosseum after the powerful emperors of Rome conquer his home. With rage in his heart and the future of the empire at stake, he looks to the past to find the strength and honor needed to return the glory of Rome to its people.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven (2016)
programme.desc: Desperate townspeople hire seven mercenaries (Denzel Washington, Chris Pratt, Ethan Hawke) to battle a greedy industrialist (Peter Sarsgaard) and his ruthless henchmen in the Old West.

programme.title: The Usual Suspects (1995)
programme.desc: A detective (Chazz Palminteri) questions a con man about his relationships with assorted criminals (Stephen Baldwin, Gabriel Byrne) and their link to a ship explosion.

programme.title: Alive (2019)

programme.title: Hostile Border (2015)

programme.title: At Close Range (1986)
programme.desc: A rural teen (Sean Penn) joins his fathers (Christopher Walken) crime clan and winds up running for his life with his girlfriend (Mary Stuart Masterson).

programme.title: Raging Bull (1980)
programme.desc: The violent nature of prizefighter Jake LaMotta leads first to a boxing championship, then to a downward spiral of self-destruction.

programme.title: No Country for Old Men (2007)
programme.desc: An aging lawman (Tommy Lee Jones) reflects on his past and laments a changing world while trying to find and protect a hunter who took the cash from a drug deal gone bad.

programme.title: Frank Millers Sin City (2005)
programme.desc: Lawmen, prostitutes (Devon Aoki, Alexis Bledel), a hulking thug and other sordid characters run amok in a crime-ridden metropolis.

programme.title: The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo (2011)
programme.sub-title: The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo (2011)

programme.title: Gangs of New York (2002)

programme.title: Black Snake Moan (2007)
programme.desc: A troubled bluesman (Samuel L. Jackson) seeks to redeem a young woman (Christina Ricci) whose uncontrollable lust threatens to destroy her life.

programme.title: Summer Days, Summer Nights (2018)
programme.desc: On the south shore of Long Island in the summer of 1983, a group of working-class teenagers and 20-somethings work their summer jobs, fall in and out of love, and wrestle with what the future holds when the summer ends and the real world beckons.

programme.title: Behind Enemy Lines (1997)
programme.desc: A former Marine (Thomas Ian Griffith) returns to Vietnam to rescue a comrade (Chris Mulkey) and retrieve nuclear triggers.

programme.title: A Chorus Line (1985)
programme.desc: Dancers auditioning for a musical reveal their innermost thoughts and desires in this adaptation of the Broadway show.

programme.title: Emma (1996)
programme.desc: Things keep getting worse after a young matchmaker (Gwyneth Paltrow) finds a mate for a simple young woman (Toni Collette) in rural 1800s England.

programme.title: Desperate Hours (1990)
programme.desc: An escaped convict (Mickey Rourke) and his two partners invade the home of an estranged Utah couple (Anthony Hopkins, Mimi Rogers).

programme.title: Sleepover (2004)
programme.desc: Four teenage friends (Alexa Vega, Mika Boorem, Scout Taylor-Compton) find adventure after a popular girl challenges them to a scavenger hunt.

programme.title: The French Lieutenants Woman (1981)
programme.desc: The relationship of actors (Meryl Streep, Jeremy Irons, Leo McKern) in a movie production parallels that of their Victorian roles.

programme.title: She Rides Shotgun (2025)
programme.desc: Marked for death by unrelenting enemies, a newly released ex-con must protect his estranged 11-year-old daughter from a corrupt sheriff and a brutal gang leader wholl stop at nothing to protect his criminal interests.

programme.title: The Running Man (1987)
programme.desc: A police-state scapegoat (Arnold Schwarzenegger) must play a TV hosts (Richard Dawson) deadly game show for the 21st-century masses.

programme.title: Black Rain (1989)
programme.desc: Two New York police detectives (Michael Douglas, Andy Garcia) take an underworld upstart back to Osaka, Japan.

programme.title: Cop Land (1997)
programme.desc: The sheriff (Sylvester Stallone) of a small New Jersey police community confronts key men (Harvey Keitel, Ray Liotta) on both sides of a law-enforcement cover-up.

programme.title: Gone Baby Gone (2007)
programme.desc: Two private investigators (Casey Affleck, Michelle Monaghan) tread dangerous ground as they scour the Boston underworld for a kidnapped child.

programme.title: Barrons Cove (2024)
programme.desc: A man with a violent past kidnaps the boy he holds responsible for his sons death. As he grows closer to uncovering the truth, hes left to wonder whether his pursuers are really seeking to protect the boy, or merely the secrets he keeps.

programme.title: I See You (2019)
programme.desc: Strange occurrences plague a small-town detective and his family as he investigates the disappearance of a boy.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction (1987)
programme.desc: A New York lawyer (Michael Douglas) with a wife (Anne Archer) and daughter sleeps with a client (Glenn Close) whose lust turns to hate.

programme.title: Wildcat (2021)
programme.desc: A captive reporter must figure out a way to escape from the militants who ambushed her convoy in the Middle East.

programme.title: Good Kill (2014)
programme.desc: An Air Force drone pilot (Ethan Hawke) begins to question the ethics of dropping bombs on Afghanistan from the safety of his post in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Drop Zone (1994)
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (Wesley Snipes) turns sky diver to nab a hijacker (Gary Busey) and his parachuter gang planning to invade the DEA.

programme.title: Changing Lanes (2002)
programme.desc: An attorney and a recovering alcoholic have a car accident which swiftly escalates into an ongoing, bitter feud.

programme.title: The Last Castle (2001)
programme.desc: A court-martialed general (Robert Redford) leads a revolt against a corrupt warden (James Gandolfini) in a military prison.

programme.title: The Haunting (1999)
programme.desc: A parapsychologist and three others stay in a house reputed to be the site of many awful tragedies and paranormal events.

programme.title: Scream (1996)
programme.desc: A psycho killer targets a past victims daughter (Neve Campbell), while a tabloid TV reporter (Courteney Cox) homes in on his identity.

programme.title: Scream 2 (1997)
programme.desc: A masked killer continues to pursue a California student (Neve Campbell) and her friends at an Ohio college.

programme.title: Scream 3 (2000)
programme.desc: Murders draw a young woman (Neve Campbell), a reporter (Courteney Cox Arquette) and an ex-policeman (David Arquette) to the set of a movie inspired by horrific events that they survived.

programme.title: Scream 4 (2011)
programme.desc: The Ghostface Killer returns with a vengeance when self-help author Sidney Prescott (Neve Campbell) arrives in Woodsboro on the last stop of her book tour.

programme.title: Undisputed (2002)
programme.desc: An undefeated world-champion prizefighter, who is convicted of rape and sent to prison, must confront and fight the reigning prison boxing champion.

programme.title: Undisputed II: Last Man Standing (2006)
programme.desc: Imprisoned in Russia, a man (Michael Jai White) relies on his street-fighting skills while fighting boxers in the ring.

programme.title: Undisputed III: Redemption (2010)
programme.desc: Uri Boyka is an inmate trapped in the toughest prison in the world. He is ready to make his comeback in a lethal boxing competition for a shot at freedom.

programme.title: Changing Lanes (2002)
programme.desc: An attorney and a recovering alcoholic have a car accident which swiftly escalates into an ongoing, bitter feud.

programme.title: Villain (1971)
programme.desc: A razor-wielding London thug (Richard Burton) robs a payroll with his gang; his pimp boyfriend (Ian McShane) has the alibi.

programme.title: The Running Man (1987)
programme.desc: A police-state scapegoat (Arnold Schwarzenegger) must play a TV hosts (Richard Dawson) deadly game show for the 21st-century masses.

programme.title: Eric Clapton: Life in 12 Bars (2017)
programme.desc: Eric Clapton is widely renowned as one of the greatest performers of all time. His isolated pursuit of his craft, and fear of selling out, served as a catalyst for his evolution as an artist.

programme.title: Under the Stadium Lights (2021)
programme.desc: Facing doubts and personal challenges both on and off the field, it takes the guidance of their team chaplain and a surrogate father figure for players on the Abilene Eagles to realize what they can achieve when they stand united.

programme.title: Parallel (2024)
programme.desc: Following the journey of Vanessa, a grief-stricken woman who mysteriously finds herself navigating between parallel spaces.

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981)
programme.sub-title: Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981)
programme.desc: Globe-trotting archaeologist Indiana Jones races the Nazis for possession of a legendary religious artifact.

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom (1984)
programme.sub-title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom (1984)
programme.desc: In 1935 archaeologist Jones (Harrison Ford), a lounge singer (Kate Capshaw) and a Chinese orphan (Ke Huy Quan) search for mystical stones stolen from an Indian tribe.

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)
programme.sub-title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)
programme.desc: Archaeologist Jones (Harrison Ford) rescues his kidnapped father (Sean Connery), and the two race the Nazis to find the Holy Grail.

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull (2008)
programme.sub-title: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull (2008)
programme.desc: Indy (Harrison Ford) and a young adventurer (Shia La Beouf) must ferret out a powerful artifact and keep it out of the hands of a deadly Soviet agent (Cate Blanchett).

programme.title: Guns Up (2025)
programme.desc: After a job goes horribly wrong, a man who moonlights as a mob henchman has one night to get his family out of the city while keeping his dark secret hidden.

programme.title: The Comeback Trail (2020)
programme.desc: Indebted to a mobster, a desperate producer tries to "accidentally" kill an aging movie star for an insurance scam. However, he soon begins to realize that the film theyre shooting is a masterpiece in the making.

programme.title: Serpico (1973)
programme.desc: Based on the true story of Frank Serpico, who sacrificed his career to expose widespread corruption in the NYPD.

programme.title: Defiance (2008)
programme.desc: In 1941 three refugee brothers (Daniel Craig, Liev Schreiber, Jamie Bell) turn a daily struggle to survive into a personal battle to save their people from the Nazis.

programme.title: The Firm (1993)
programme.desc: A law-school grad uncovers a sinister secret about the Tennessee firm that made him an offer he couldnt refuse.

programme.title: Wolves (2016)
programme.desc: A talented high school basketball players (Taylor John Smith) dreams of playing college ball are jeopardized by his hard-drinking fathers (Michael Shannon) compulsive gambling.

programme.title: Love and Monsters (2020)
programme.desc: A young man and his traveling companions battle an array of monsters during an 80-mile journey to find the woman he loves.

programme.title: Pixie (2020)
programme.desc: Pixie sets out to avenge her mothers death and attempts a heist that will give her the means to leave her small-town life behind. When the plan goes horribly wrong, shes forced to team up with a pair of misfits who are clearly in over their heads.

programme.title: Masterminds (2016)
programme.desc: An armored-car driver (Zach Galifianakis) helps a flirty co-worker (Kristen Wiig) and her friends pull off a heist, then finds himself holding the bag after they double-cross him.

programme.title: Bringing Out the Dead (1999)
programme.desc: After too many years on the job, an EMS paramedic (Nicolas Cage) begins an emotional descent during 56-hour tour.

programme.title: Inside Angling
programme.desc: We go back in time, where people are friendly and truly still love their neighbor, history is cherished and Queen Elizabeth reigns supreme. St Helena Island is a true gem dropped into the Atlantic somewhere between Brazil and Africa.

programme.title: Wild Fly
programme.desc: When we heard word of aquatic research taking place in South Africas largest game reserve, the Kruger National Park, a real opportunity to encounter fish in a wild habitat, that had not yet seen a fly, was immediately seized upon.

programme.title: Wild Fish Wild Places
programme.desc: Returning to the wilds of Alaska, Denis and Uncle Rod cant resist the pull of Yakutat - a place theyve fished before but couldnt stay away from. The pair brave cold, rain, and rough terrain to chase down some of the biggest steelhead in the world.

programme.title: Fishing the Wild With Mike Robinson
programme.desc: Joined by local spearfishing champion, Elisabeth, who only uses a pole spear the crew learns some of the secrets of the Arctic. Mike breaks down a halibut and takes it back to his restaurant in England.

programme.title: Hooked on Africa
programme.desc: Wallow in the luxury game sanctuary of Sausage Tree Camp, knowing that these untapped waters hold some beasts of legendary proportions. With a wealth of fauna, literally on your doorstep, experience a real taste of Africa.
